description: List information related to measurement regions. Displays details about all measurement objects including ID, position, radius, and calculated quantities such as porosity, coordination number, stress, and strain. This is the primary command for viewing measurement results.
notes: Lists all measurement objects in the model
Displays calculated quantities: porosity, coordination number, stress, strain
Measurements must be calculated first (via model clean or FISH query)
If measurements not yet calculated, may show incomplete or default values
No parameters or keywords - lists all measurements
Output format is tabular for easy reading
Use after measure create to verify measurement setup
Use after model clean to see measurement results

examples.description: List all measurement regions and their properties
examples.use_case: View all measurement configurations and results

examples.command:
measure create radius 4.0
model clean
measure list
examples.description: Create measurement, calculate results, then list
examples.use_case: Complete measurement workflow with result viewing

examples.command:
measure create id 1 radius 3.0
measure create id 2 position (10,0,0) radius 3.0
model clean
measure list
examples.description: Create multiple measurements, calculate, list all

examples.command:
measure list
measure modify id 1 radius 5.0
model clean
measure list
examples.description: List before modification, modify, recalculate, list after

examples.command:
measure create radius 5.0 tolerance 0.001
model cycle 1000
model clean
measure list
examples.description: Setup measurement, run simulation, calculate, view results

notes: Python SDK has methods to query individual measurement properties
measure list provides formatted overview of all measurements
Python allows programmatic access to specific values
Command interface better for quick inspection

command_vs_python.python:
# Python SDK approach - consult PFC documentation
# itasca.measure module provides query methods
# Can iterate over measurements and query properties

workflow: 1. Create measurement: measure create id 1 radius 5.0 position (2,3,0)
3. Check ID, position, radius are correct
common_use_cases.notes: Catch configuration errors before running expensive calculations

workflow: 5. Analyze porosity, coordination number, stress, etc.
common_use_cases.notes: Primary use case - view calculated measurement data

workflow: 1. Create region 1: measure create id 1 position (0,0,0) radius 3
2. Create region 2: measure create id 2 position (10,0,0) radius 3
4. Compare: measure list shows both, compare porosity/stress
1. Initial state: model clean, measure list, record values
3. After loading: model clean, measure list, compare values

typical_workflow: 4. Analyze output: porosity, coordination, stress, strain

measurement_id.use: Reference measurement in other commands (modify, delete)

position.description: Center coordinates (x, y, z) of measurement region

coordination_number.description: Average number of contacts per body

stress.components: σxx, σyy, σzz, σxy, σxz, σyz (depending on 2D/3D)

strain.components: εxx, εyy, εzz, εxy, εxz, εyz (depending on 2D/3D)

measurement_calculation_requirement.description: Measurements must be calculated before meaningful results appear

uncalculated_measurements.status: Configuration exists but no results yet
uncalculated_measurements.values_shown: Default or zero values for porosity, stress, etc.
uncalculated_measurements.how_to_fix: Call model clean to trigger calculation

calculated_measurements.values_shown: Actual calculated porosity, coordination, stress, strain
calculated_measurements.trigger: Calculations triggered by model clean or FISH query

measurement_calculation_requirement.recommendation: Always call model clean before measure list to ensure current values

coordination_number.note: Minimum ~2 for stability in gravity, ~6 for random close packing

stress.magnitudes: Depend on material properties, loading conditions

no_measurements_scenario.description: What happens when no measurements exist
no_measurements_scenario.output: Empty list or message indicating no measurements
causes: All measurements deleted with measure delete

warnings.message: measure list may show default/zero values if measurements not calculated yet
warnings.mitigation: Call model clean before measure list to ensure current values

warnings.message: Measurement values not automatically updated during cycling
warnings.mitigation: Call model clean after simulation to update measurement values

warnings.message: measure list shows all measurements - cannot filter by ID or range
warnings.mitigation: Use Python SDK for selective querying if needed

troubleshooting.issue: measure list shows empty or no measurements
solutions: No measurements created yet - use measure create
All measurements may have been deleted
Use measure create to add measurements
Verify measurement creation succeeded

troubleshooting.issue: Porosity, stress, strain showing zero or default values
solutions: Measurements not calculated yet - call model clean
model clean triggers measurement calculations
Run simulation to generate results (model cycle)
Ensure measurement region contains bodies

troubleshooting.issue: Measurement values seem wrong or unexpected
solutions: Verify measurement position and radius with measure list
Check if measurement region is in correct location
Verify tolerance setting (use measure modify if needed)
Recalculate: model clean
Check if region actually contains bodies (may be empty)
measure list shows all measurements - look through output
Measurement ID may not exist - verify with measure create
May have been deleted - recreate if needed
No filtering by ID - must scan all output

troubleshooting.issue: Need to export measurement data for analysis
solutions: Use measure dump to export to table
measure list is for viewing, not exporting
For programmatic access, use Python SDK
Can redirect measure list output to file (OS dependent)

performance_considerations.listing_cost: Very fast - just displays stored data
performance_considerations.no_recalculation: measure list does NOT trigger recalculation
performance_considerations.output_size: Output size proportional to number of measurements
performance_considerations.recommendation: Safe to call frequently for monitoring

measure_list.data_shown: All measurement properties and calculated values

measure_dump.use_when: Export for analysis, plotting, external tools

list_vs_dump.recommendation: Use list for viewing, dump for exporting

good_times: After measure create to verify configuration
After model clean to view results
Before measure modify to see current state
After measure modify to verify changes

output_format.description: Typical format of measure list output
output_format.note: Exact format may vary by PFC version and 2D/3D mode

multiple_measurements.description: How measure list handles multiple measurements
multiple_measurements.all_displayed: All measurements shown in single output
multiple_measurements.comparison: Easy to compare values across different regions
multiple_measurements.use_case: Spatial variation analysis - compare porosity, stress across regions

measurement_state.description: Different states measurements can be in
